title: Drawing, Design for a Dining Table of Mahogany and Inlay, 1900–05
title_raw: Design for a Dining Table of Mahogany and Inlay
medium: Pen and black ink on thin, cream paper
markings: Watermark across verso bottom : ORIENTAL LINEN
inscribed: In pen and black ink, at center right, center left and lower right, with arrow pointing to table top, base and right leg, respectively: "inlay"; in pen and black ink, across bottom, at right of sheet: "Dining Table/of Mahogany and Inlay"; in pen and black ink, at lower right of design, pointing to foot of right leg: "Brass"; in graphite, at upper right of design, with an arrow pointing to table top: "inlay"; in graphite, above top center of design and in pen and black ink at upper right of design: numerical notations indicating dimension.
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Round molded table top raised on faceted column-like support sitting on conforming base rounded at bottom with four splayed legs on casters (3 shown).

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for a Dining Table of Mahogany and Inlay, 1900–05. Pen and black ink on thin, cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-107
